org.apache.derbyTesting.system.oe.direct

Class StatementHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.derbyTesting.system.oe.direct.StatementHelper
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    SimpleNonStandardOperations, Standard

    class StatementHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class for direct operations. Maintains the connection and a hash table of PreparedStatements to simplify management of PreparedStatement objects by the business transactions.

    • Field Detail

      • conn

        protected final java.sql.Connection conn

      • statements

        private java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.sql.PreparedStatement> statements
        Map of SQL text to its PreparedStatement. This allows the SQL text to be in-line with code that sets the parameters and looks at the results. Map is on the identity of the SQL string which assumes they are all constants (and hence interned). Assumption is that this will provide for a quicker lookup than by text since the statements can be many characters. May also allow easier sharing with other implementations such as a Java procedure which could have a different prepareStatement method.

    • Constructor Detail

    • Method Detail

      • prepareStatement

        protected java.sql.PreparedStatement prepareStatement(java.lang.String sql)
                                               throws java.sql.SQLException
        Prepare a statement, looking in the map first. If the statement does not exist in the map then it is prepared and put into the map for future use.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • close

        public void close()
           throws java.sql.SQLException
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • reset

        protected void reset(java.sql.PreparedStatement ps)
              throws java.sql.SQLException
        Reset a PreparedStatement. Closes its open ResultSet and clears the parameters. While clearing the parameters is not required since any future execution will override them, it is done here to reduce the chance of errors. E.g. using the wrong prepared statement for a operation or not setting all the parameters. It is assumed the prepared statement was just executed.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • getAddress

      • getAddress

        protected Address getAddress(Address address,
                             java.sql.ResultSet rs,
                             java.lang.String firstColumnName)
                      throws java.sql.SQLException
        Get the address from a query against an order entry WAREHOUSE, DISTRICT or CUSTOMER table.
        Parameters:
        address - Object to fill in
        rs - ResultSet already positioned on the current row.
        firstColumnName - First column that makes up the address.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
